  Source   Edit

The nn module provides higher level functions for building neural network models using the nimxla graph API.

Imports

nimxla

Types

InitFunc = proc (c: Client; dims: openArray[int]; dtype: DataType): Buffer
InitFunc defines a function used to initialise a learnable parameter.   Source   Edit 
Module = object
  variables*: seq[Variable]
  forward*: proc (x: Node): Node
A module holds the state for a set of variables together with a forward computation which depends on an input value.   Source   Edit 
Optimizer = proc (params: Params): seq[Variable]
Optimizer function to update the model weights.   Source   Edit 
Variable = object
  name*: string
  data*: Buffer
A Variable is a learnable parameter associated with a module.   Source   Edit

Procs

proc add(m: var Module; modules: varargs[Module]) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Add variables from modules to m.   Source   Edit 
proc compileTest(c: Client; m: Module; input: Node): Executable {.
    ...raises: [Exception, BuilderError], tags: [RootEffect].}
Build the execution graph for the given module and compile it to an executable. The executable returns the output from m.forward(input)   Source   Edit 
proc compileTrain(c: Client; m: Module; input: Node;
                  lossFn: proc (y: Node): Node): Executable {.
    ...raises: [Exception, ValueError, BuilderError, KeyError], tags: [RootEffect].}
Build the execution graph for the given module and compile it to an executable. The executable returns a tuple with the following outputs:
  • pred: result of m.forward(input)
  • loss: result of lossFn(pred)
  • <v1.name>_grad, ...: gradients for each input variable with respect to the loss
  Source   Edit 
proc constantInit(value: SomeFloat): InitFunc
Create a new buffer with a constant value.   Source   Edit 
proc crossEntropyLoss(pred, target: Node): Node {.
    ...raises: [Exception, BuilderError, ValueError], tags: [RootEffect].}
Mean cross entropy loss function calculated from softmax output. Pred should be predicted values with shape [n, classes] while target is a 1d vector of I64 labels each in range 0..classes.   Source   Edit 
proc gradNames(m: Module): seq[string] {....raises: [], tags: [].}
List of all the variable gradient output names for this module.   Source   Edit 
proc initLinear(c: Client; id: string; nin, nout: int; weights: InitFunc;
                biases = constantInit(0.0'f32); dtype = F32): Module {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Create a new fully connected linear layer with the given unique id and number of inputs and outputs. Weight parameters are initialised using the weights function. If biases is not nil then bias parameters are initialised using this function and added to the output.   Source   Edit 
proc mseLoss(pred, target: Node): Node {....raises: [Exception, BuilderError],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Mean square error loss function.   Source   Edit 
proc newVariable(c: Client; name: string; dims: openArray[int]; dtype: DataType;
                 init: InitFunc): Variable {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Allocate a new variable with the given name and shape and initialise values.   Source   Edit 
proc normalInit(mean = 0.0; stddev = 1.0): InitFunc {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Create a new buffer with random values chosen from a normal distrubution.   Source   Edit 
proc optimAdam(c: Client; m: Module; learnRate: float; weightDecay = 0.0;
               beta1 = 0.9; beta2 = 0.999; eps = 1e-8): Optimizer {.
    ...raises: [Exception, BuilderError, XLAError], tags: [RootEffect].}
Builds and compiles an optimizer using the Adam algorithm. This returns a function which takes as input a table with all of the named weight and gradient parameters and returns the list of model weight variables.   Source   Edit 
proc optimSGD(c: Client; m: Module; learnRate: float; weightDecay = 0.0;
              momentum = 0.0; nesterov = false): Optimizer {.
    ...raises: [Exception, BuilderError, XLAError], tags: [RootEffect].}
Builds and compiles a stochastic gradient descent optimizer to optimize the variables for module m. This returns a function which takes as input a table with all of the named weight and gradient parameters and returns the list of model weight variables.   Source   Edit 
proc param(b: Builder; p: Variable; suffix = ""): Node {.
    ...raises: [Exception, BuilderError], tags: [RootEffect].}
Create a new parameter node from this Variable   Source   Edit 
proc setParams(m: Module; params: var Params) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Add model variables to the params table   Source   Edit 
proc softmax(a: Node; axis = -1): Node {....raises: [Exception, BuilderError],
    tags: [RootEffect].}
Softmax operation, shifted for numerical stability.   Source   Edit 
proc uniformInit(min = 0.0; max = 1.0): InitFunc {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Create a new buffer with uniform random values from min to max.   Source   Edit 
proc varNames(m: Module): seq[string] {....raises: [], tags: [].}
